article:
'Object-oriented programming' ('OOP') is a programming paradigm that represents
concepts as "objects" that have data fields (attributes that describe the
object) and associated procedures known as methods. Objects, which are usually
instances of classes, are used to interact with one another to design
applications and computer programs. {{Cite journal
  | last = Kindler | first = E. last2 = Krivy | first2 = I. title = Object-
  | Oriented Simulation of systems with sophisticated control publisher =
  | International Journal of General Systems year = 2011 | month= pages =
  | 313â343}} , section 1.6 "Object-Oriented Programming" C++
  | and Java are examples of object-oriented programming languages.
